body.text: - Limits who knows about what happened. - Gives you time to figure out what you want to do. - Allows you to process trauma in your own time.

- You may be risking your own safety - especially if this person is still a threat to you. - You may be going without help from your school that you are legally entitled to - like changes to your schedule, dorm location, or a no contact order to protect you from the perpetrator and allow you time to process trauma and continue your education. If your school does not know, they canâ€™t help you. - You may worry that it could happen to someone else. - You may not be able to access supportive services or therapy. - Some legal options are time sensitive, and you might run out of time depending on how long you wait. - You may be risking your health if you have hidden injuries or want to explore options for unwanted pregnancy or STDs.
